Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.

Published_Course_Section_Data.description: Contains data for Course Section Data

validation.validation: Maximum Units cannot be less than Minimum Units
End Date cannot be before the Start Date.
Total AU Offering Percent must equal 100
The Course Section Start Date must be on or after the Course Effective Date.
Published Instructor Roles must have a Role Usage of Course Section.
Combination Course Sections must have the exact Combination Instructional Formats specified on the Course Definition.
Course Sections for Course Definitions which have a Course Component specifying Combination as an Instructional Format, must specify Combination as their Instructional Format.
The Total Contact Hours for Course Section must equal the sum of the Combination Instructional Formats you selected .
You must specify at least 1 Other Unit Type and Other Unit Value when you select the Other Unit Values check box.
This Course Section has the Override Standard Meeting Patterns with Custom Meeting Patterns option selected. Specify a custom meeting pattern or remove the override.

This Course Section cannot have a custom meeting pattern when the Override Standard Meeting Patterns with Custom Meeting Patterns option is not selected. Select the option or specify a standard meeting pattern.
The course section must have its Start Date and End Date within a standard academic period.
Course Section cannot have both Reserved Capacity and Unlimited Capacity.
A Course Section can only contain either Custom Meeting Patterns or Standard Meeting Patterns, not both.
You may have up to 5 Reserved Capacity Lines
Cannot have duplicate Reserved Capacity Eligibility Rules.
Minimum and Maximum Units need to be divisible by the Partial Unit Increment.
Partial Unit Increment must be 0.50, 0.25 or 0.
Partial Units are only enabled when Minimum Units is less than Maximum Units.
Submit reserved capacity line eligibility rules for this course section that have registrations tied to them.
To submit a course section, ensure the Course Tag Academic Unit is in the same institution as the Academic Unit for the course definition.
The Title of this course section isn't overridable.
The Educational Taxonomy Codes of this course section isn't overridable.
The CIP Code of this course section isn't overridable.
The Abbreviated Title of this course section isn't overridable.
The Competencies of this course section aren't overridable.
The Eligibility Rule of this course section isn't overridable.
The Course Tags of this course section aren't overridable.
The Learning Outcomes of this course section aren't overridable.
The Description of this course section isn't overridable.
The Minimum Units of this course section aren't overridable.
The Contact Hours of this course section aren't overridable.
The Partial Units Increment of this course section isn't overridable.
The Maximum Units of this course section aren't overridable.
The Unit Type of this course section isn't overridable.
To submit a course section, make sure that the academic unit for Learning Outcomes is the same as the academic unit for the course definition.
The published course section cannot be set to preliminary.
The Academic Period cannot be changed for a published course section.
The Course Section submitted cannot be updated because it has a Section Status of Preliminary
The published course section start and end cannot be changed.
A Course Section must be specified in the request.
Course Section already has an Event in progress.
To edit a course section definition, ensure it doesn't have a Canceled status.
